page.title: 10Surnames in Kingsley
page.content: A few surnames are very common in our part of Staffordshire and they have been found in the village for many years. We looked on the tombstones in the churchyard and found these names from more than a hundred years ago: Keeling, Clowes, Goldstraw, Prince, Malkin, Stoddard, Wheawall and Bradshaw. These names are still found in our village today. There are children in the village school called Keeling, Clowes, Stoddard and Bradshaw. The school caretaker is Mr Goldstraw. One of the govenors is Mr Joe Malkin, who has lived in the village for 70 years. Many new families have moved into the new houses in Kingsley in the last two decades. The old names are found on the farms and in the old part of the village.
